definitions.definition: Tending to stick ; able to adhere via the drying of a viscous substance .
examples: Is this tape sticky enough to stay on that surface?
This is a sticky situation. We could be in this for weeks if we're not careful.

definitions.definition: Of weather: hot and windless and with high humidity , so that people feel sticky from sweating .
Tending to stay the same; resistant to change.

examples: We should make the printing direction sticky so the user doesn't have to keep setting it.

definitions.definition: Fixed at the top of the list of topics or threads so as to keep it in view.
labels: of threads on a bulletin board
definitions.label_groups: Internet , of threads on a bulletin board

definitions.definition: Compelling enough to keep visitors from leaving.
examples: A woman has come to me with the complaint that her website is not sticky : 70% of the visits last 30 seconds or less.

definitions.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a stick .
examples: What's something that is brown and sticky ? A stick

main_definition: Tending to stick ; able to adhere via the drying of a viscous substance .
secondary_definitions: Of weather: hot and windless and with high humidity , so that people feel sticky from sweating .
( finance ) Tending to stay the same; resistant to change.
( computing , informal , of a setting ) Persistent .
( computing , of a window ) Appearing on all virtual desktops .
( Internet , of threads on a bulletin board ) Fixed at the top of the list of topics or threads so as to keep it in view.
( Internet , of a website ) Compelling enough to keep visitors from leaving.
( informal ) Resembling or characteristic of a stick .
